metadata.title: GoHighLevel Documentation - Sales Automation System
metadata.purpose: Key documentation for building a sales automation system (lead form → booked call → sales call → docusign → closed)

categories.name: Workflows & Automations
categories.description: Core automation engine for building sequences triggered by events

docs.title: Introduction to Workflows and Automations
keyConceptsFeatures: Workflows automate repetitive tasks via triggers and actions
Triggers = starting events (form submission, appointment booked, etc.)
Actions = tasks performed (send email, update CRM, assign lead)
No coding required - visual builder interface
Can include multiple triggers and actions in one workflow
docs.salesFlowApplication: Foundation for entire automation system. Every stage transition (lead → qualified → booked → closed) is powered by workflows.

docs.title: Getting Started with Workflows
keyConceptsFeatures: Three steps: Choose Trigger → Add Filters → Add Actions
Trigger filters allow precision (e.g., only specific forms, specific call types)
Pre-built Workflow Recipes available as templates
IF/Else conditions for branching logic
Chaining multiple workflows together for complex processes
Webhooks for external integrations
Allow Reentry setting controls if contact can re-enter workflow
docs.salesFlowApplication: Use workflow chaining: Workflow A (lead capture) → Workflow B (nurture) → Workflow C (booked call) → Workflow D (post-call) → Workflow E (contract signed). Each stage has its own workflow.

docs.title: Workflow Builder Walkthrough
keyConceptsFeatures: Infinite Canvas for visual workflow design
Stats View for monitoring communication performance
Test Workflow feature with real contacts
Version History for tracking changes
Draft vs Published modes
Drip actions control flow timing
Goal actions let contacts skip steps
Best practice: keep workflows small enough to view in one screen
docs.salesFlowApplication: Use Stats View to monitor email/SMS performance at each stage. Use Draft mode to test before going live. Goal events useful for skip logic (e.g., if they book, skip nurture sequence).

docs.title: A List of Workflow Triggers
keyConceptsFeatures: Contact Events: Birthday, Contact Created, Contact Changed, Tag Added/Removed
Form Events: Form Submitted, Facebook Lead Form, Trigger Links Clicked
Call Events: Call Status (incoming, outgoing, voicemail)
Email Events: Open, Click, Bounce, Unsubscribe
Appointment: Status Changed, Customer Booked
Opportunity: Status Changed, Created, Pipeline Stage Changed, Stale Opportunity
Payments: Invoice, Payment Received, Order Form Submission, Documents & Contracts, Subscription Status
Inbound Webhook for external system integrations
docs.salesFlowApplication: Key triggers for sales flow: Form Submitted (lead capture), Customer Booked Appointment (booking), Opportunity Status/Stage Changed (pipeline movement), Documents & Contracts (signed/completed), Payment Received (closed won).

docs.title: A List of Workflow Actions
keyConceptsFeatures: Contact Actions: Create, Update, Tag, Assign to User, Add Note/Task
Communication: Send Email, Send SMS, Call, WhatsApp, Slack, Internal Notification
Opportunities: Create/Update Opportunity, Remove Opportunity
Appointments: Update Status, Generate One-Time Booking Link
Payments: Stripe One-Time Charge, Send Invoice, Send Documents & Contracts
Logic: IF/Else, Wait Step, Split Test, Go To (chain workflows), Remove from Workflow
AI: GPT-Powered AI Prompt action
Data: Webhooks, Google Sheets integration
docs.salesFlowApplication: Critical actions: Send Email/SMS (follow-ups), Create/Update Opportunity (CRM tracking), Send Documents & Contracts (proposals/agreements), IF/Else (branch based on lead quality), Wait Steps (spacing communications).

categories.name: Pipeline & CRM Setup
categories.description: Visual sales pipeline management and opportunity tracking

docs.title: Understanding Pipelines
keyConceptsFeatures: Visual kanban-style sales tracking
Custom stages representing each step in sales journey
Track conversion rates, identify bottlenecks
Automate actions when opportunities move stages
Example stages: Lead Capture → Qualification → Appointment → Proposal → Closing
Best practice: Keep stages action-oriented with clear criteria
Use pipeline triggers for automated follow-ups
docs.salesFlowApplication: Create pipeline stages matching sales flow: New Lead → Discovery Call Booked → Call Completed → Proposal Sent → Contract Signed → Closed Won. Each stage can trigger next workflow.

docs.title: Understanding Opportunities
keyConceptsFeatures: Opportunity = potential sale linked to a contact
Tracks value, status, stage, owner, and history
Statuses: Open, Won, Lost, Abandoned
Centralized notes and communication history
Stage-based forecasting for revenue prediction
Automation triggers when status/stage changes
Team assignment and collaboration features
docs.salesFlowApplication: Create opportunity when form submitted with deal value. Move through stages as sales progresses. Use Won status when contract signed and payment received. Track abandoned for follow-up campaigns.

docs.title: Workflow Action - Create Opportunity
keyConceptsFeatures: Auto-create opportunity when workflow triggers
Configure: Pipeline, Stage, Name, Source, Status, Value
Duplicate handling: allow or prevent multiple opportunities per contact
Dynamic naming using custom values (e.g., {{contact.first_name}})
Opportunity owner can be auto-assigned or follow contact owner
Edge case: No contact = no opportunity created
docs.salesFlowApplication: Trigger: Form Submitted → Create Opportunity in 'New Lead' stage with source 'Website'. Set initial value if known. Enable duplicates for repeat customers or disable for single-deal businesses.

docs.title: Workflow Trigger - Opportunity Changed / Pipeline Stage Changed
keyConceptsFeatures: Trigger workflows when opportunity data changes
Opportunity Status Changed: fires on Open/Won/Lost/Abandoned
Pipeline Stage Changed: fires when moving between stages
Stale Opportunity: fires when stuck in stage too long
Filter by specific pipelines or stages
docs.salesFlowApplication: Pipeline Stage Changed is key trigger for advancing sales flow. E.g., when moved to 'Contract Sent' stage → send contract via workflow. When moved to 'Closed Won' → send welcome sequence.

docs.title: How to Set Up a Booking Calendar
keyConceptsFeatures: Personal Booking Calendar for 1-on-1 meetings
Configure availability, buffer times, meeting durations
Generate shareable booking link or embed code
Connect to Google Calendar for sync
Set up automated reminders to reduce no-shows
Recipe: Appointment Confirmation + Reminder workflow
docs.salesFlowApplication: Sales call booking: Create 'Sales Call' calendar with appropriate duration (30-60 min). Share link in follow-up emails. Connect to rep's calendar. Set up confirmation + 24hr + 1hr reminders.

docs.title: Book Appointment Action in Workflows
keyConceptsFeatures: Auto-schedule appointments from workflow triggers
Team member assignment: Calendar Default (round robin) or specific person
Dynamic date/time from trigger data (webhooks, forms)
Override availability option (use sparingly)
IF/Else branching on booking success/failure
Limitation: Cannot use with recurring calendars
docs.salesFlowApplication: Auto-book follow-up calls after initial consultation. Branch logic: if booking succeeds → confirmation sequence, if fails → notify team to manually schedule.

docs.title: Appointment Status Trigger
keyConceptsFeatures: Trigger on: Scheduled, Rescheduled, No-Show, Completed, Cancelled
Customer Booked Appointment trigger for new bookings
Filter by specific calendar
Update Appointment Status action for marking completed
docs.salesFlowApplication: Customer Booked → move opportunity to 'Call Scheduled' stage + send confirmation. No-Show → trigger re-engagement sequence. Completed → move to next stage + send follow-up.

docs.title: Getting Started - Automatic Email and SMS Followup
keyConceptsFeatures: Email Drip Sequence recipe for automated follow-up
Form Submitted trigger with form filter
Customize subject, message content, attachments
SMS follow-up for higher engagement
Drip Mode: control batch size and interval (e.g., 100 contacts per day)
Prevents overwhelming communication channels
docs.salesFlowApplication: Lead capture form → Email drip (Day 1: Welcome, Day 3: Value content, Day 5: CTA to book call). Add SMS touch points for urgency (Day 2: Quick check-in, Day 4: Booking reminder).

docs.title: Workflow Action - Send Email
keyConceptsFeatures: Personalized email with custom values (merge fields)
HTML or plain text templates
Attachments support
Track opens and clicks via Email Events trigger
Use IF/Else to branch based on email engagement
docs.salesFlowApplication: Personalize with {{contact.first_name}}. Include calendar booking link. Track opens - if no open after 48hrs, send SMS follow-up.

docs.title: Workflow Action - Send SMS
keyConceptsFeatures: Automated personalized text messages
Custom values for personalization
Great for reminders, promotions, quick updates
Higher open rates than email
Respect DND settings
docs.salesFlowApplication: SMS for high-intent moments: appointment reminders, booking CTA, contract signing reminder. Keep messages short and actionable.

docs.title: SMS Templates (Snippets)
keyConceptsFeatures: Pre-saved text templates for consistency
Use in conversations, workflows, campaigns
Insert custom values dynamically
docs.salesFlowApplication: Create templates for: Initial follow-up, Booking confirmation, Pre-call reminder, Post-call follow-up, Contract sent notification.

docs.title: Getting Started - Launch A Funnel
keyConceptsFeatures: Funnels = step-by-step landing pages for specific goals
Create from blank, AI, or templates
Template library with proven designs
Funnel Editor for customization
Form Builder integration
Custom domain support
Split testing on funnels
docs.salesFlowApplication: Lead gen funnel: Step 1 (Landing page with offer) → Step 2 (Form capture) → Step 3 (Thank you page with calendar embed). Each step optimized for conversion.

docs.title: Site Builder Overview
keyConceptsFeatures: Funnels vs Websites: Funnels for specific conversion goals, Websites for general presence
Drag-and-drop editor with sections, rows, columns, elements
Mobile responsive editing
Tracking code integration (Facebook Pixel, Google Analytics)
Pop-up settings for lead capture
SEO meta data configuration
Order forms for payment collection
Stats tracking for page views and opt-ins
docs.salesFlowApplication: Build landing page targeting ideal customer. Include: Headline, Pain points, Solution, Social proof, Lead capture form. Use pop-up for exit intent.

docs.title: Creating Forms Inside Funnels
keyConceptsFeatures: Form Builder integrated in funnel/website editor
Customizable fields for lead qualification
Form submission triggers workflows
Survey functionality for more detailed data capture
docs.salesFlowApplication: Lead qualification form: Name, Email, Phone (required). Optional: Company size, Budget range, Timeline (helps qualify and segment leads).

docs.title: Form Submitted Trigger
keyConceptsFeatures: Triggers workflow when any/specific form submitted
Filter by form name
Access form field data in workflow
Most common entry point for sales automation
docs.salesFlowApplication: Form Submitted → Create Contact → Create Opportunity → Add Tag → Send Welcome Email → Wait 5 min → Send SMS → Add to Nurture Sequence. This is the starting point of entire sales flow.

docs.title: Documents & Contracts in HighLevel – Setup and Guide
keyConceptsFeatures: Built-in document/contract management under Payments
Create from blank, upload PDF, or use templates
E-signatures with full audit trail (IP, timestamp)
Integrated payments - collect on signing
Variables for dynamic content (contact name, dates, etc.)
Multiple recipients with signing order
Document statuses: Draft, Sent, Viewed, Signed, Completed
Expiry dates for time-limited offers
docs.salesFlowApplication: After sales call, send proposal document with: Services outlined, Pricing table, Terms, E-signature field, Payment collection. Track viewing to know when to follow up.

docs.title: Send Contracts & Proposals Using Workflows
keyConceptsFeatures: Send Documents & Contracts workflow action
Trigger-based sending (tag added, stage change, etc.)
Reusable templates with dynamic custom values
Options: Send directly or Create as Draft for review
Send via Email, SMS, or both
Track status in Documents dashboard
Follow-up workflow on document events
docs.salesFlowApplication: Trigger: Opportunity moved to 'Proposal Stage' → Send proposal template via email. Trigger: Opportunity moved to 'Contract Stage' → Send contract template. Use dynamic values for personalization.

docs.title: Automate Workflows with Documents & Contracts Trigger
keyConceptsFeatures: Trigger workflows when document status changes
Statuses: Sent, Viewed, Signed/Accepted, Completed
Filter by: Template, Recipient Type, Value
Ideal for: Sending notifications, updating pipeline, tagging contacts
Multiple status changes can trigger separately
docs.salesFlowApplication: Document Viewed → Send internal notification to follow up. Document Signed → Move opportunity to 'Closed Won' stage + Send welcome email + Create invoice. This closes the loop from lead to customer.

actions: Email Drip Sequence (3-5 emails over 7 days)

IF/Else: If no engagement after 7 days → move to cold list
